“Hey, I think we should those bodies before some notices.”

“Good idea,” Maxi says. After you, Michelle and Jenna dress up, Apollo and you take the body that had belonged to you and him, Kat and Jenna take the body that they had used, Millie and Michelle take the body that they had used, and Maxi and Davis take the body that used to be Maxi’s. They are hidden somewhere you are sure they won’t be found. The same thing occurs with Davis’ headless, tailless original body. You then think of something...

“Guys, where’s my car?”

“Oh, I left it at Michelle’s,” Apollo admits. “You think we should fetch it?”

“‘Fetch it’?” You are amused by that. “Yes I think we should before it is impounded.”

“I guess so,” Millie says. “And I think we should take Goldie and the sword with us. If Michelle’s sister is there, we can duplicate her body parts and use them to anthropomorphize Goldie.”

“What, the sword can duplicate body parts now?” you ask.

“Upgrade. It can still cut off parts.”

Five minutes later, you, Michelle and your dog copies have taken Goldie, the sword, Michelle’s car, and are driving off to Michelle’s house, leaving Kat and Jenna at your place and Davis, Maxi and their former owner at their place. When they get there, Apollo and Millie take the sword first. After restraining Goldie (and reassuring her), they cut off her head and tail. Then they give the sword to you.

“This button appeared during the upgrade,” Apollo tells you, pointing the extra button. “If you hold it down it will allow the duplication. I’m not sure what happens if you hold the other one down for long enough - maybe it causes a reset or something.”

Shortly afterwards, Michelle’s sister Nina shows up.

“Hi Michelle, how’s it hanging?” she asks.

“Well, I’ve had an interesting day,” Michelle says.

“Hey, John, I almost didn’t notice you.”

“Ah, no need for that,” you say. “Listen, I have something to show you.” Holding the duplication button down, you slice at her, duplicating all her body parts except the head.

“Woah, how did you do that?” Nina wants to know.

“I swapped heads with my dog with the sword, and then he went off and did some cutting himself,” you explain. “The sword must have upgrade twice, because when he came to get my head off and restore my body (and I say restore) he had grown fur all over him.”

“Well, I guess that explains the monster dogs,” Nina says, referring to the anthro Apollo and Millie.

“Monster dogs?”

“You know, from that book Lives of the Monster Dogs. Expect they don’t look like something from the nineteenth century.”

“Of course we don’t,” Apollo says begrudgingly. He takes Nina’s duplicate body parts from you, then he and Millie assemble a dog-headed human from these body parts and Goldie’s head and tail. As the being starts to show signs of life, you hit the other button quickly. Goldie feels a twitch in her jaw and near the base of her neck, and the fur on her head and tail spreads to the rest of her body.

“Woah, what have you guys just done?” is the first thing Goldie says.

“Just giving you an upgrade,” Apollo says. Something is clear from the offset - Goldie is naked. The sword didn’t exactly copy clothes. (Davis had been supplied with his clothes from what Maxi could find in his human body part donor’s room.)

“Why I am naked, and you having clothes?” Goldie asks.

“Oh, John and Michelle were clothed when we swapped,” Apollo says.

“Well that explains it,” Goldie says. “I’m going to need some clothes, in case anthro dogs are treated like humans when it comes to nudity. Mind if I borrow some clothes?”

“Go ahead,” Nina says.

After Goldie goes inside, less than eleven minutes go by before she returns wearing a blue t-shirt and black socks. Your group notices that she is wearing one of Nina’s skirts over bicycle shorts.

“You look like a canine tomboy with a girly streak,” Millie comments.

“Might as well be,” Goldie says.

“Ok then, I’m going to get you some shoes.”

The Labrador and the Golden Retriever get into Michelle’s car and drive off, leaving you, Michelle, Nina nad Apollo standing there, pondering what to do next.

1153112132255222111325121.content:
The four of you see Adam, the German Shepherd, walking with his owner Geoff.

“Hello there, Geoff,” Nina says.

“Hi, Nina,” Geoff replies. “How are things?”

“Good,” Nina replies.

“That’s great. Who’s the boy there?”

“This is John,” Michelle explains.

“Hello John,” Geoff says to you.

“Hello there,” you reply.

Apollo stands there, looking at Adam. He wonders what would happen if Adam were given a humanoid body.

“I’m just noticing the guy in the dog suit over there,” Geoff says, not realizing what Apollo really is, “His outfit looks fairly realistic.”

“Actually...”

“What?”

“Mind if I show you something?” you say. Holding the sword without holding the duplication button, you hack at Adam, cutting his head and tail.

“Hey, what did you just do to my dog?!” Geoff responds in shock. He notices that Adam’s head is still moving. “What’s going on?!”

“Just something I found in the woods,” you say. “A few incidents involving a dog and now it can do this...” And you hack at Geoff, holding the duplication button this time. Geoff is left looking at a pile of what look like his own body parts, sans head. In fact, they are his body parts, sans head, duplicated.

“Now here comes the fun part,” you say. You build a headless version of Geoff, and attach Adam’s head to it. You then hit the button. You realize just as you do so that you forgot to attach Adam’s tail, but it does not matter, because while Adam’s new body is growing its fur, the tail grows back.

“You ok, Adam?” Geoff asks the now-anthropomorphic German Shepherd.

“Yes, Geoff, I’m fine,” Adam replies, now able to speak.

“Wait, did you just talk?” Geoff is bewildered by what happened to his canine companion. It’s not surprising that Adam would say Geoff’s name - he got him three years ago from a dog shelter, but the GSD is now talking like a 26-year-old.

“Whoa, this is cool.”

“Even cooler because it was the result of my little adventures,” Apollo says.

“Really, so that’s not a suit?” Geoff becomes intrigued. Apollo nods, to show that he is not a guy in a suit. At that moment, Millie and Goldie come back in Michelle’s car, Goldie now wearing sneakers and both dog girls carrying boxes of shoes. It becomes clear they did not just go to the shoe store, since they have bags of clothes shopping with them.

“Your dogs were changed too?” Geoff asks in surprise.

“Exactly,” Michelle says. “How did you manage the shops?”

“It was okay,” Millie says. “The shoe store staff did think we looked unusual, but they let us pass.”

“And as you can tell, we were down in the clothes shop too,” Goldie says. “Saves us borrowing your clothes. There’s some for Maxi, some for Davis, some for Kat, some of you - Apollo - and some for both of us.”

“How did you manage to buy clothes?” Nina asks.

Michelle had her purse in this pocket when Apollo originally headswapped her, and Millie says she used it to pay for them and the shoes, much to Michelle’s shock. Somehow, the dogs knew her credit card PIN. This gets you thinking - did all the cutting, button pressing and anthropomorphizing give the dogs alternative memories?

“Speaking of clothes, mind if I borrow some from you?” Adam asks Geoff.

“Ok,” is all Geoff can say. As Adam goes inside, Nina and Michelle help their dog versions with the shopping, while you and Apollo take the sword, your car and some of the shopping bags, and drive off.

After chatting with the girls for a while, Geoff goes into his house. Adam is lounging around on the couch in the front room when he finds him, wearing a grey tee-shirt, brown jeans and grey socks.

“You know something, Adam,” Geoff says.

“What would that be, Geoff?” Adam asks.

“With a body like that, I was thinking, you could become a lounger rather than just a pet.”

“That’s cool.”

“Ok then. It puts us on an equal footing then. I’ve already suggested it to the girls.”

---

Meanwhile, you and Apollo get back to the house, where Apollo mentions something.

“I was thinking, maybe we could make more dogs like me.”

“What do you mean?”

“I’m going to take myself and Kat around the place, copying the parts of everyone who has a dog and then creating more anthro dogs with those parts and the dogs’ heads and tails. You okay with that?”

“Ok, just send me the images of the transformed dogs, alright?”

With that, you give Apollo your phone, tell him how you unlock, step inside and call for Kat. She comes out and walks off with Apollo, leaving you with Jenna and her phone. Over the next few 90 minutes, Apollo sends Jenna the images of anthropomorphized dogs. Raul’s pit bull Sancho, Sanford’s Great Dane Sandy, Reyna’s Cairn Terrier Smokey Bear, Mr Hood’s Maltese dog Jessica, William’s Bichon Frise Marshmallow, Ana’s pit bull Ion, Coriander’s Great Dane Nyx, Ms Lovelace’s Malionis Foxy, Gemma’s Blue Lacy Azure, Emma’s Corgi Junior, the local stray mutt Mr Wilde; all of them are anthropomorphized by copying human body parts with the duplication button, cutting off the dog heads with normal cuts, attaching the heads to the assembled human bodies and pressing the other button, giving them furry bodies and restoring their tails. Apollo comments in the captions that he had to remove the breasts and vagina from Smokey’s new body, Ion’s new body, Azure’s new body, and Junior’s new body, and the penis and testicles from Jessica’s new body, before hitting the button in each case. The removed feminine features from Smokey, Ion, Azure and Junior were replaced with copies of Apollo’s genitals, while the removed masculine features of Jessica’s body were replaced with copies of Kat’s vagina and breasts (of course, these dogs would be much more casual about nudity than humans, but would choose to wear clothes around humans).

A few minutes after the last message, Apollo and Kat come home, having called it quits on chopping and anthropomorphizing for the day.

“We’re finished for the day,” Apollo announces, “We’ll carry on tomorrow.”

“Ok then,” you say. “I think that by next month or so all the dogs in this town will be anthropomorphized with the rate you went today.”

“You think?” asks Kat.

“Yes, I’m sure, actually.”

“Fine, we’ll see about it tomorrow.”

The four of you (Jenna included) have a quick meal before you get ready for bed. You and your fellow human decide to let Apollo and Kat sleep in your respective beds, to get a feel for living life like a human. You change into your pajamas and climb into the bed. After a while, Apollo joins you, wearing only his boxers.

“Mind if I sleep on the side?” he asks.

“You probably need to,” you say. “When you were a regular dog, your tail was a sensitive pressure point. I imagine your new tail would be similar. That would mean you’d have to cut holes in your new leggings.”

“You’re right, actually,” Apollo says. “That was what I was on about. The car journeys were a pain. Imagine if you had a tail and it got compressed against the seat! I think I might have to start up a car modification firm.”

“Why, so that you can make holes in the seats of cars anthro dogs buy to make their journeys more comfortable?”

“Exactly.”

With that he gets into the bed beside you, lying on his left side. You both fall asleep.

Meanwhile, the girls get into bed in Jenna’s room. Kat has had the same idea as Apollo, and sleeps on her right side. She wears just the bra and bloomers Jenna had on under the shirt and pants she had when Apollo originally headswapped her.

---

When you wake up the next morning, you find Apollo in your bathroom - and he’s not doing anything human, despite being a humanoid. Instead, he is drinking out of the toilet bowl. He is cupping his hands, putting them into the bowl, taking them out and drinking from the cupped hands. You do not like the look of it - you clearly never thought of the toilet being used that way by anyone looking human.

“Apollo, what are you doing?!” you demand. “That’s not a drinking fountain!”

“Sorry, John,” Apollo says, still able to talk. “I was feeling thirsty and some of my old canine habits came back.”

“So that explains it,” you say sarcastically. “Old habits die hard.” You remember reading somewhere that dogs can handle toilet water because their bodies are better able to cope with it. Maybe this quality has come back in some way. After all, he is an anthropomorphic husky now.

At breakfast, you and Jenna eat like normal humans, using cutlery, but the two dogs eat directly out of dog bowls which they put on the table. Jenna is not one bit amused, but Kat insists that it is a natural thing for dogs. The foods they eat are also more like the stuff you have bought for them in the past. After breakfast, they roll around in the grass for a few minutes before going back inside.

You and Jenna help Kat cut holes in her and Apollo’s new leggings. During this, you observe that her head has altered to be more like that of a mix of a Siberian Husky puppy and a Labrador Retriever puppy. However, since dogs age faster than humans, you guess that this is because she has become a teenage anthropomorphic dog.

“How old would you consider yourself, Kat?” you ask. “One? One and a half? Two?”

“Nineteen,” Kat replies.

“Not fourteen?” you react with amazement. You were expecting her to become younger.

“You’re thinking about it too generally,” Kat replies sarcastically. “Every normal dog breed is different. With those old bodies they age differently. Apollo has a version of your body, so if he has changed as well he might be about seventeen had he always been like that.”

You go off to find Apollo applying flea powder to his head, and sure enough his head has changed to resemble that of a husky puppy. You wonder if the magic of the sword caused the dogs’ head-ages to start changing (and their aging to slow down to human speed) after so much cutting yesterday. A few minutes later, he has dressed in a red shirt, blue trousers with a ‘tail-hole’ in them, white socks, yellow running shoes and a black hoodie; all bought by Millie and Goldie during their shopping spree yesterday.

“Maybe we might end up getting alternative memories after this,” Apollo says.

“What do you mean?” you ask.

“Well, I might as well end up being classed as Russian-American or something.”

“Ok. I understand where you’re coming from with that. Siberian Huskies are a Russian breed, after all.”

Some time after that exchange, Apollo says goodbye to you, Jenna and Kat and takes the sword. As he is leaving, Kat suggests something to you...

“Can we play frisbee?”

You grab a frisbee and the three of you walk outside. As Jenna watches, you throw the frisbee at Kat, who catches it in her teeth. This carries on for several minutes.

Meanwhile, Apollo steps outside to find Millie standing there. She is wearing a blue jumper, green trousers and brown woman’s shoes. Her head has altered to become more like that of a Labrador puppy.

“Hi Millie,” Apollo says, then kisses Millie in a dog-like way. “Why are you here?”

“I was wondering if you were up for a date tonight,” Millie says.

“Fine then. I was about to go on a dog anthropomorphizing run today, but maybe we can do a limited number.”

“Perfect. First that, then the date.”

“Right.”

Maxi comes out to them, still the same as before expect her head has adjusted to the age of the body it is attached to. Her humanoid body is somewhat older than Apollo’s, Millie’s, or Kat’s, so her head now resembles that of a two-year-old Aussie.

“Hey guys,” Maxi says to Apollo and Millie. She has completely lost the accent she originally had and is now speaking in an Australian accent.

“Whoa, Maxi, you’ve changed quite a bit, haven’t you?” Apollo comments on her changes.

“Yeah, I guess so.”

“How’s Davis?” Millie asks.

“He’s ok,” Maxi replies. “He and Foxy have gone to the park as of a few minutes ago.”

“He really likes that Malionis, doesn’t he?” Apollo comments.

“Yes, and he considers this to be the chance to be really with her. He’s okayed it with Ms Lovelace.”

“That’s great. Wanna join us in anthropomorphizing another dog?”

“Sure, which one?”

Apollo replies...

115311213225522211132512111.content:
"My mother." Then he remembers it has been a while since he last saw his mother. "I'm hoping she's still alive."

"You think she might be dead?" Millie replies.

"I half-think."

"That's fine, Apollo," Maxi replies. "Where would she be if alive, as a matter of interest?"

"On John's aunt's farm."

"Well, if she's dead and John's aunt has a collie and farmhand, it won't be a wasted journey."

"Ok, I get you."

Then comes the issue of getting there. Fortunately, the Clarks from down the road are on their annual road trip and happen to know where John's (your) aunt's farm is, and the three are able to hitch a ride in their RV. There are four members of the Clark family - the father; the mother; the son, Ethan; and the daughter, Amy. The three dogs, who do not disclose their nature to the human family, ride in the back of the RV. During the trip, they spy a companion. There is a German Shorthaired Pointer in the back of the RV with them, with a liver coat color. Thinking quietly, Apollo has Millie cut at him with the duplication button held down, which duplicates his body parts. The only parts she doesn't copy are his head and tail. As they are assembling the parts, Apollo has a look at the GSP dog's collar.

"'BRUNO'" he reads, "so this is a boy then. We got it right didn't we?"

"So right, we did," Maxi says, "Now we should be near the farm. Let's get this head off and on the body and then off the RV before they release what we have done."

They lie the assembled anthro husky body on the couch on its side, then cut Bruno's head off. Apollo says his goodbyes and thanks through the partition separating them from the Clarks, then he and the girls get Bruno's head onto the body. Then they get off the RV with Bruno's old body hidden in a box that Millie brought and quickly hit the button after closing the door, just before it drives off, continuing on its way. In the RV, Bruno's new body's fur changes color to match his head, and his tail reappears.

On the road, Apollo manages to find the path leading to the aunt's farm.

"There is it."

"What's your mother's name, by the way?" Millie asks.

"Sierra."

They take the headless GSP body out of the box and dump into the bushes out of view of anyone. They then walk down the lane for a few dozen yards and arrive on the aunt's farm. The aunt indeed has a female farmhand who has a collie (of the Rough variety). They find the aunt resting in a chair. She does not notice them as they go into the house. The three discover that Sierra, Apollo's mother, is in fact still alive.

Ideas for extra choices:
- She has somehow turned anthro and seems to have a husband.
- She is still normal, and loves her son's changes.
- What happens when the Clarks find the transformed Bruno?

1153112132255222111325121113.content:
To the surprise of Apollo, Maxi and Millie, Sierra has turned into an anthro husky; while her head is the same and her tail is still there, her central body has turned into a fur-covered human female torso, her forelegs into fur-covered human arms, her forepaws into fur-covered human hands, her hindlimbs into fur-covered human legs, and her hindpaws into fur-covered human feet. She is wearing female farmer's clothes.

"Mother?" Apollo thinks to himself. Then he notices something. Sierra seems to have a wedding ring on her new hand. Then he sees something else. Another anthro dog. He realizes that this creature is an anthro version of his father, Diego, who he never thought would be there. Diego is wearing male farmer's clothes, and what looks like a second wedding ring is on his finger. It looks like Apollo's mother and father are married!

"Father? This can't be." Apollo thinks to himself. Then he speaks out loud. "Mom, Dad?" The two older huskies turn and look at him.

"Ah, there's our boy," Sierra says, seemingly thinking this is normal. "The one who went off to live with missus' nephew fourteen years ago. Come to visit, I take it?"

Apollo, Maxi and Millie are confused. "Fifteen years? It can't have been fifteen years," Apollo thinks to himself, but because he doesn't want to mention or allude to the sword his thoughts come out as "Yes, that's right. And I brought some friends along."

"Ah, good thing, Apollo," Diego says, "Good you were able to make some friends. Who are those pretty girls?"

"I'm Maxi Anderson, and this is Millie Lee," Maxi says. Apollo is confused - did she just assign herself and Millie surnames to play along with this? Millie is similarly confused, but Diego and Sierra are not.

"It's nice to meet you, girls," Sierra says, "Millie wouldn't happen to have to be related to Luna's husband, would she?"

"Who's Luna?" Apollo asks.

"Your aunt, sweetie," Sierra says, "Diego's sister, up in town. She married a Labrador twenty-one years ago. They had a daughter named Katherine."

"Katherine?"

"Exactly. She's well, isn't she?"

"Yes."

"Actually," Millie cuts in, "can we go to the living room for a while?"

"Ok, go ahead," Diego says.

Apollo and the girls slip away and sit down in the living room. They notice a family portrait that if you had been there you would swear you never saw before, labelled with a reference to a family known as the Chernoffs. This name gets Apollo interested - it seems like Anglicized Russian, as if a Russian family immigrated into Alaska before the purchase of 1867, stayed in the territory, changed their name and lived to see the gold rush at the end of the century. Apollo wants to inspect it, but he has other priorities first.

"Why did you introduce yourself as an Anderson, and Millie as a Lee?" he asks Maxi.

"I reckoned that giving myself a surname would allow me to fit in better," she says. Then she has an admission: "...though shortly afterwards, I started getting these alternative memories. My brain tried to convince me that I had lived in Sydney for most of my life before moving here for university."

"Well, that explains the accent," Millie says sarcastically. "Does that mean that I potentially came from Portland or Cleveland?"

"Portland, Maine?"

"Exactly."

"And the 'Katherine' thing," Apollo says, "Was mother refering to Kat?"

"Possibly. Maybe when you hit the button, not only were our parents anthropomorphized, but reality changed so that they would think they had always been like this."

"Speaking of which, I'd like to know who these Chernoffs are," Apollo says. He has a look at the portrait and is surprised by what he sees. The image is of his parents, with him standing between them. It looks it was taken on a previous visit.

"That's odd. I must have changed reality greatly. Though the button pressing probably doesn't affect other relatives right away, which would be why Davis wasn't anthro when he saw him after turning ourselves."

"Ok, so there's a change in you, isn't there?" Maxi says. "'Apollo Chernoff.' But you and your parents speak with American accents; Pacific Northwest I think, which probably means relatives in Seattle. That would make you Russian-American huskies."

"You have a point there," Apollo says. He takes the sword and inspects a bedroom, finding an old shirt, old jeans that have a hole in the tail area, and old boots. This gives Apollo an idea, and he summons Maxi and Millie into the room.

"Here, Maxi," he says, giving Maxi the sword, "you can create a clone of me for yourself. If mother and father don't see us at this they will think he is my littermate."

"Ok, then," Maxi replies, "one of you for me, and the other for Millie, then." She swings at him, copying all his body parts - this time, including his head and tail. She assembles the parts on the bed and dresses him in the shirt, jeans and boots, making sure to put the tail through the hole in the jeans. The new Apollo gets up.

"Hi guys, I'm new," he says.

"Well, this is interesting," Millie says.

"I guess so," Apollo says.

"I need a name," the other Apollo says.

"Would Yuri do?" Maxi says.

"'Yuri?' I like that."

The house briefly rumbles around the four. They quickly go back to the living room.

"Apollo, Yuri, are you doing fine with your girls?" they hear Sierra saying out loud.

"Yes, we are," the two say, both confused and embarrassed. When he inspects the Chernoff portrait again, he notices that Yuri has appeared in the image next to him. Then he notices something else - he sees five more young huskies that he seems to recognize as members of the litter he came from. Apart from himself, the members of the litter were Axel (who appears in the image wearing farmer's clothes), Oscar, Tonya and Nova. Apollo was the middle child of the litter. Axel was born first, followed by Tonya, then Apollo, then Nova, and finally Oscar. Now all of them are anthromorphized - it must have been a delayed effect of hitting the button, at least 12 hours or something. If the anthro Apollo is 17 (and so would Yuri), then Axel would be 18 or 19, Tonya would be 18, Nova would be 15 and Oscar would be 11.

You think about life ahead now. You have Millie, Yuri has Maxi. You think of anthromorphizing the collie in the yard, but first something happens.

Note:
- The surnames here for Apollo, Maxi and Millie - for this chapter going forward on this path - have the first letters on names of their breeds. 'Chernoff' was inspired by 'Chukcha', an alternative name for the Siberian Husky; 'Anderson' has the same starting letter as 'Aussie'; and 'Lee' has the same starting letter as 'Labrador'.
- My ideas for other choices are:
- - Maxi gets a regular phone call from her parents in Australia.
- - Meanwhile, Kat gets a surprise visit from her parents.
- - Meanwhile, with Bruno and the Clarks...

“Did you just push that button, Apollo?” Millie asks, before realizing what she has done. “Hey did I just talk?”

“Whoa, sounds like we just gained the ability to do that,” Apollo says.

“You said it, Apollo,” Maxi says. “Thing is, we still have these furless human bodies beneath our furry canine heads.”

Apollo feels the pale bottom of his neck with his fingers, then with the top, furry part. The skin now feels the same in both places. He guess it is the same on the rest of his head.

“My head skin is different now,” he says.

“Yeah, but what about the others?” Maxi asks.

Millie responds. “Yeah, but we need to check the phones first.”

“The ones the original holders of our bodies put in their pockets?”

“Yep.”

Apollo checks what had been his owner’s phone, but everywhere the human head of John should be in the pictures, Apollo’s husky head appears instead. Not only, but Kat, Maxi and Millie have their heads on the bodies Apollo gave them minutes to hours ago in these images. It is the same for the phones the girls have.

“Strange, these pictures were taken years ago.”

Suddenly, the door they are outside opens and Maxi’s brother Davis appears in the doorway. He thinks nothing of what’s happened to them; he, presumably like everyone else, thinks this normal.

While her three fellow dog-headed humans are out, Kat lets Goldie loose in the garden and sets about feeding you, Michelle, Jenna and Maxi’s owner. She makes you four sit at the dining table, placing four small bowls in front of you.

“Didn’t think it would come to this,” you sigh as the four paws of your dog body rest on the chair.

“What, us getting swapped with dogs?” Michelle wonders, “And our own dogs for that.”

“Yes, exactly.”

“So why did I have to get involved in this?” Jenna asks.

“They decided they wanted to give your other dog - as in Kat - a human body and felt that your body would be perfect,” Maxi’s owner says.

Getting an idea you lift the sword with your mind and hack your severed arms into further pieces, severing the hands at the wrists before levitating a pair of gloves out of your drawer and placing them on your hands before levitating your hands up to approximately where they would naturally hang from your body. You looked in the mirror and laughed at your little Rayman cosplay, making your fingers flex though you couldn't actually feel them. Using one of your floating hands you grab...

You lift your cellphone out of your pocket using your psychic power but find that you are unable to dial her number on the touch screen in the same manner. "Huh, I guess my psychic powers don't conduct electricity." You comment, vaguely remembering how capacitive touchscreens work. Using one of your corporeal hands you dial successfully and hold the phone to your ear, wanting nothing more than for Michelle to witness how cool this thing was! Right as the ringing stops you begin speaking, so excited you didn't even wait for Michelle to say hello. "Baby, it's me. You've GOT to come over here, I've got something incredible to show you!"
"Uh, okay. You've kind of caught me at a bad time here. I'm in the middle of a movie right now and I have to return it to the video store in two hours. Could you wait a little or is it an emergency?" She responds.
"I'll pay the late fee, I'll buy you the damn movie if you come over here asap!" You decree.
Michelle sighs "Alright, but I'm going to hold to that you know? This is actually a pretty good movie." With that she hangs up, leaving you to your own devices while you awaited her arrival. You mostly just messed around with your hands, floating them around the house without looking to see how well you had memorized the place. While you occasionally bumped into walls and got turned around one or two times you were able to successfully bring a glass of water from the kitchen, a book from the living room, and a condom taken from the bathroom's medicine cabinet back to your room before Michelle arrived.
Rather than walking down to greet her you sit on your bed and send your hands floating off to the front door, opening it wide before waving at her. She does not react well.

After waking her up, calming her down, and explaining the longsword, Michelle seemed far more interested. "Trading body parts for telepathy? That's crazy!" She says, taking a sip of water.
"Psychokinesis" You correct. "You can't read minds or anything, you can just move physical objects."
Michelle shrugs. "You know what I meant, nerd. Anyway I have a great idea for what I want to do with the sword." She announces. What does she plan to do with it?

1553331112.content:
"Do you remember my friend Amber from back in high school?" She asked, acting as though it had been years rather than a few short weeks.
"Vaguely, yeah. I remember meeting her a couple of times when she was hanging out with you but in the last few weeks of school it seemed as though she just dropped off of the map. I don't even remember seeing her at graduation." You muse.
Michelle frowned. "Well there's a reason for that. Amber got into a car accident three weeks before the end of school. She survived, but got terrible burns and scars all over her arms, legs, and some on her body and had to sit out the graduation while she was in the hospital. The only reason it wasn't highly publicized around school was due to the circumstances of the accident, something about one of the drivers being the son of some rich politician and on drugs or something. Really hushed up the whole thing."
"I see, sorry to hear that. But how does this relate to the long sword?" You ask.
"Because, Amber could use it to become mobile and independent again! She lost most of her fingers and can hardly move her limbs ever since the accident, but this sword could give her her life back!" She announced.
"That's... really altruistic of you." You say, feeling a bit guilty that you were just going to use the sword to have fun.
Michelle smiles. "Plus I've known her for years and can tell you right now that she's... a bit freaky, if you catch my drift."
You now return her smile. "Alright, sounds like a plan then!" Rather than reconnecting your arms you levitate a jacket over and position your hands so that they are coming out of the sleeves, giving the illusion that you had arms in case someone looked your way. Next you grab one of your dad's old golf bags and stuff the sword and your arms into it before slinging it over your back and walking out the door with Michelle following right behind you. You begin driving while she directs you to her friend Amber's house, finding it a bit tricky at times to keep the sleeves up and your hands moving right and concentrate on the road AND listen to Michelle's directions all at once, your psychic powers straining somewhat, but you manage to get there without incident. The two of you walk up to the door and knock, then proceed to wait almost a whole minute as a slow, electric sound edges towards the door. "Who is it?" Calls the voice inside, one belonging to a teenage girl.
"It's me, Michelle. Are your parents home?" She inquired.
"Oh, hi Michelle!" She chirps giddily. "No, my parents are away right now, won't be back for another two hours or so. It's been the first time in a while they've left me home alone, probably because I'm more mobile now!" She say, the door opening electronically to show Amber and her new mobility, an electric wheelchair.
You and Amber studied one another, Amber not expecting anyone to be with Michelle and you not really having understood how severe the damage was. Amber was dressed in a sleeveless blue shin length skirt, its material rather thin and showing off all manner of scars. Her arms were scarred, misshapen, and ended with only one or two warped fingers on each. Her legs were withered and bent at odd angles. Amber's body looked to be in rather good shape, you imagine she was on a sports team of some kind before the accident as it still looked pretty toned despite putting on a little bit of weight due to the inactivity of the past few weeks. Her face was untouched save for a set of scars on her right cheek past where the right earlobe probably resided before the accident, and one big red splotch on her chin. It was a pretty face, its beauty shining through the damage. "Who's he?" Amber asked hesitantly.
"Hi, I'm Michelle's boyfriend John." You say. "What if I told you that you could have even more mobility back?" You ask,using your powers to drop your jacket off revealing your floating hands.
Amber is stunned. "I... how?"
"May we come in?" You ask, not wanting to stay outside too long like this. Amber rolls her chair back and both you and Michelle enter her home, Michelle closing the door behind her. You drop the golf bag on the ground and allow your hands out of your psychic grip to really show Amber what you could do. "Earlier today I found a sword. Not just any sword, a magic one. One that could grant the user incredible powers." You explain, unzipping the bag and levitating the sword in the air. "Whatever part of someone gets cut off by this sword goes numb, BUT they gain the ability to move things with their mind! The more parts they cut off, the stronger their powers get. Mind over matter, if you will." You explain. "As well, anything cut off can be reattached, even if it's on the wrong spot or on the wrong person! It'll work just as well as the real thing, but it also makes you easier to be moved by psychokinetics. Sort of a balance thing if you will." You explain to her.
Amber stares at the sword, her eyes filling with emotion. "So, I could move like I used to?"
You smile. "Better." You toss the bag across the room on a whim, then lift each piece of furniture one by one (though you struggle with some of the heavier stuff).
"THAT'S AMAZING!" She squeals. "COULD YOU USE IT ON ME?!"
"That's the plan." Michelle says. "So, what would you like cut off?"
Amber answers...
